0.cdata!: La lutte contre la sécheresse au Maroc

theme: Water resource management,Rural markets,Rural services and infrastructure,Natural disaster management

abstracts.cdata!:
In 1994 and 1995, a drought that reduced
            Morocco's agricultural gross domestic product by 45
            percent threatened to cause severe long-term damage. The
            World Bank responded with a 100 million dollars emergency
            drought recovery project aimed at restoring crop and
            livestock production, improving rural roads, and supplying
            drinkable water. A seed distribution program, combined with
            plentiful rain, enabled cereal production to recover to 9.7
            million tons in the 1995-96 season from 1.6 million tons in
            the 1994-95 crop. The project also supported the
            construction and rehabilitation of 1,650 kilometers of rural roads.
